Greatest common divisor of a finite set

type:
{α : Type u_1} →
  {β : Type u_2} → [inst : CancelCommMonoidWithZero α] → [inst : NormalizedGCDMonoid α] → Finset β → (β → α) → α
name: Finset.gcd
docString: Greatest common divisor of a finite set

The greatest common divisor of any rational number's numerator and denominator equals 1.

type: ∀ (self : ℚ), self.num.natAbs.Coprime self.den
name: Rat.reduced
docString: The greatest common divisor of any rational number's numerator and denominator equals 1.

The theorem `Nat.gcd_dvd` states that for all natural numbers `m` and `n`, the greatest common divisor (GCD) of `m` and `n` is a divisor of both `m` and `n`. In other words, the GCD of two numbers divides each of the two numbers. This is a fundamental property of the GCD, typically denoted mathematically as $\text{gcd}(m, n) | m$ and $\text{gcd}(m, n) | n$.

type: ∀ (m n : ℕ), m.gcd n ∣ m ∧ m.gcd n ∣ n
name: Nat.gcd_dvd
docString: The theorem `Nat.gcd_dvd` states that for all natural numbers `m` and `n`, the greatest common divisor (GCD) of `m` and `n` is a divisor of both `m` and `n`. In other words, the GCD of two numbers divides each of the two numbers. This is a fundamental property of the GCD, typically denoted mathematically as $\text{gcd}(m, n) | m$ and $\text{gcd}(m, n) | n$.

Greatest common divisor of a multiset

type: {α : Type u_1} → [inst : CancelCommMonoidWithZero α] → [inst : NormalizedGCDMonoid α] → Multiset α → α
name: Multiset.gcd
docString: Greatest common divisor of a multiset

For every natural number n, the greatest common divisor of n and 1 is 1. (i.e. n and 1 are coprime.)

type: ∀ (n : ℕ), Nat.Coprime 1 n
name: Nat.coprime_one_left
docString: For every natural number n, the greatest common divisor of n and 1 is 1. (i.e. n and 1 are coprime.)

This theorem states that for any rational number, the absolute value of its numerator and its denominator are coprime. In other words, the greatest common divisor of the numerator and the denominator of any rational number is 1. This is a form of simplifying rational numbers where the numerator and the denominator have no common factors other than 1, also known as "reduced form".

type: ∀ (self : ℚ), self.num.natAbs.Coprime self.den
name: Rat.reduced
docString: This theorem states that for any rational number, the absolute value of its numerator and its denominator are coprime. In other words, the greatest common divisor of the numerator and the denominator of any rational number is 1. This is a form of simplifying rational numbers where the numerator and the denominator have no common factors other than 1, also known as "reduced form".

The greatest common divisor between two elements.

name: GCDMonoid.gcd
docString: The greatest common divisor between two elements.

The greatest common divisor (gcd) of two positive natural numbers,
viewed as positive natural number.

name: PNat.gcd
docString:
The greatest common divisor (gcd) of two positive natural numbers,
viewed as positive natural number.

type: ZNum → ZNum → Num
name: ZNum.gcd

The GCD is a divisor of the first element.

type: ∀ {α : Type u_2} [inst : CancelCommMonoidWithZero α] [self : GCDMonoid α] (a b : α), gcd a b ∣ a
name: GCDMonoid.gcd_dvd_left
docString: The GCD is a divisor of the first element.

Greatest Common Divisor (GCD) of two `Num`s.

type: Num → Num → Num
name: Num.gcd
docString: Greatest Common Divisor (GCD) of two `Num`s.

The GCD is a divisor of the second element.

type: ∀ {α : Type u_2} [inst : CancelCommMonoidWithZero α] [self : GCDMonoid α] (a b : α), gcd a b ∣ b
name: GCDMonoid.gcd_dvd_right
docString: The GCD is a divisor of the second element.

No zero divisors.

type: ∀ {α : Type u_2} [self : CanonicallyOrderedCommSemiring α] {a b : α}, a * b = 0 → a = 0 ∨ b = 0
name: CanonicallyOrderedCommSemiring.eq_zero_or_eq_zero_of_mul_eq_zero
docString: No zero divisors.

Any common divisor of both elements is a divisor of the GCD.

type: ∀ {α : Type u_2} [inst : CancelCommMonoidWithZero α] [self : GCDMonoid α] {a b c : α}, a ∣ c → a ∣ b → a ∣ gcd c b
name: GCDMonoid.dvd_gcd
docString: Any common divisor of both elements is a divisor of the GCD.

Least common multiple of a finite set

type:
{α : Type u_1} →
  {β : Type u_2} → [inst : CancelCommMonoidWithZero α] → [inst : NormalizedGCDMonoid α] → Finset β → (β → α) → α
name: Finset.lcm
docString: Least common multiple of a finite set

Nonzero divisors have valuation greater than zero.

type:
∀ {R : Type u_1} [inst : CommRing R] [inst_1 : IsDomain R] [inst_2 : IsDedekindDomain R]
  (v : IsDedekindDomain.HeightOneSpectrum R) (x : ↥(nonZeroDivisors R)),
  0 < IsDedekindDomain.HeightOneSpectrum.intValuationDef v ↑x
name: IsDedekindDomain.HeightOneSpectrum.int_valuation_zero_le
docString: Nonzero divisors have valuation greater than zero.

The gcd of two elements in a bezout domain.

type: {R : Type u} → [inst : CommRing R] → [inst : IsBezout R] → R → R → R
name: IsBezout.gcd
docString: The gcd of two elements in a bezout domain.

For `d ∣ n`, the totient of `n/d` equals the number of values `k < n` such that `gcd n k = d`

type: ∀ {n d : ℕ}, d ∣ n → Nat.totient (n / d) = (Finset.filter (fun k => Nat.gcd n k = d) (Finset.range n)).card
name: Nat.totient_div_of_dvd
docString: For `d ∣ n`, the totient of `n/d` equals the number of values `k < n` such that `gcd n k = d`

The modulus of an integer by another as a natural. Uses the E-rounding convention.

type: ℤ → ℤ → ℕ
name: Int.natMod
docString: The modulus of an integer by another as a natural. Uses the E-rounding convention.

Nonzero divisors have nonzero valuation.

type:
∀ {R : Type u_1} [inst : CommRing R] [inst_1 : IsDomain R] [inst_2 : IsDedekindDomain R]
  (v : IsDedekindDomain.HeightOneSpectrum R) (x : ↥(nonZeroDivisors R)),
  IsDedekindDomain.HeightOneSpectrum.intValuationDef v ↑x ≠ 0
name: IsDedekindDomain.HeightOneSpectrum.int_valuation_ne_zero'
docString: Nonzero divisors have nonzero valuation.

`gcdD a b = gcd a b`

name: PNat.gcdD
docString: `gcdD a b = gcd a b`

name: Nat.dvd_left_iff_eq
docString: Two natural numbers are equal if and only if they have the same divisors.

name: Nat.odd_mod_four_iff
docString: A natural number is odd iff it has residue `1` or `3` mod `4`
